title: GOD in DES TOURS DES BABEL

HDG.ID.content: if science must begin w/ God, it is the science of God: theology, theologia (mytho-poetic utterances about gods w/out reference to creed or ecclesiastical doctrine) > why is science, which, since Fichte, is name for metaphysics, theology? > theology tied to ontology, question of beings as such and as a whole: wholeness of this whole, unity of all beings that unifies as generative ground [causa sui?]

motif.name: GOD in DES TOURS DES BABEL
motif.title: GOD in DES TOURS DES BABEL

HDG.ID.linkedContent: if science must begin w/ God, it is the science of God: theology, theologia (mytho-poetic utterances about gods w/out reference to creed or ecclesiastical doctrine) > why is science, which, since Fichte, is name for metaphysics, theology? > theology tied to ontology, question of beings as such and as a whole: wholeness of this whole, unity of all beings that unifies as generative ground [causa sui?]

HDG.ID.content: the difference constitutes ground plan in structure of essence of metaphysics, perdurance results in & gives Being as generative ground > this ground must be properly accounted for by that for which it accounts, by the causation through original matter—cause as causa sui [Nietzsche]: right name for god of philosophy

HDG.IM.content: pay attention to Being by paying attention to how it is said: “God is,” “The earth is,” etc.

HDG.IM.linkedContent: pay attention to Being by paying attention to how it is said: “God is,” “The earth is,” etc.

HDG.BT.content: [causa sui] res cogitans as ens creatum; God, ens infinitum, as ens increatum > createdness (Geschaffenheit) as something’s having been produced (Hergestelltheit): essential to ancient conception of Being

motif.name: GOD in DES TOURS DES BABEL

HDG.BT.linkedContent: [causa sui] res cogitans as ens creatum; God, ens infinitum, as ens increatum > createdness (Geschaffenheit) as something’s having been produced (Hergestelltheit): essential to ancient conception of Being

HDG.WM.content: a history of nothing: from Greek [?] ex nihilo nihil fit (from nothing, nothing comes to be) to Christian dogma ex nihilo fit—ens creatum (from nothing comes—created being) (nothing indicates fundamental conception of beings [here, as counterconcept to summum ens, God as ens increatum?]) > God & nothing [Augustine]

motif.name: GOD in DES TOURS DES BABEL
motif.title: GOD in DES TOURS DES BABEL

HDG.WM.linkedContent: a history of nothing: from Greek [?] ex nihilo nihil fit (from nothing, nothing comes to be) to Christian dogma ex nihilo fit—ens creatum (from nothing comes—created being) (nothing indicates fundamental conception of beings [here, as counterconcept to summum ens, God as ens increatum?]) > God & nothing [Augustine]

HDG.IWM.content: being that exists is the human being, not rocks, not horse, not trees, not angels, not God [Being does not exist?] [cf. 284n X Being]

motif.name: GOD in DES TOURS DES BABEL
motif.title: GOD in DES TOURS DES BABEL

HDG.IWM.linkedContent: being that exists is the human being, not rocks, not horse, not trees, not angels, not God [Being does not exist?] [cf. 284n X Being]

HDG.QB.content: Nietzsche (every contemporary thinks/poetizes “for”/“against” him) heard a calling demanding humans to prepare for dominating the earth, not war but polemos that first lets gods, humans, freemen, slaves appear in their essence, leads to a critical encounter of X Being [compared to this encounter, world wars remain superficial (vordergründig)] > did he collapse (stürzte) or take his thinking as far as he was able to go? > this thinking no easier for us: must restrict itself to something precursory (Vorläufigeres): give careful thought to ancient/venerable words whose saying addresses (zuspricht) us to essential realm of nihilism & its recovery (Verwindung) [paleonym]

HDG.FS.content: no system strictly speaking in Kant, Kant speaks of unconditioned necessity, which humans require, as abyss, eternity itself in its terrible sublimity > God, for Kant, appears as abyss, “The Impossibility of Cosmological Proof of the Existence of God” = system’s impossibility

motif.name: PHILOSOPHY AS AN INSTITUTION (ACADEMIA, UNIVERSITY) via KANT

motif.name: GOD in DES TOURS DES BABEL
motif.title: GOD in DES TOURS DES BABEL

HDG.FS.linkedContent: no system strictly speaking in Kant, Kant speaks of unconditioned necessity, which humans require, as abyss, eternity itself in its terrible sublimity > God, for Kant, appears as abyss, “The Impossibility of Cosmological Proof of the Existence of God” = system’s impossibility

HDG.FS.content: God as Summum Ens, actus purus essendi—how does Aristotle’s energeia become actualitas? > Romans understood ergon, energeia, on basis of AGERE, “to make,” in an ontic sense, so Summum ens becomes CREATOR, ENS CREATUM (INCREATUM) > ontic determination of actualitas together w/ Aquinas’ Summum Ens w/ Ipsum esse, ontology suppresses possibility for question of Being > to restore (weider einsetzen) philosophy to its own essence: purge (entlasten) it of its Christian element

HDG.FS.linkedContent: God as Summum Ens, actus purus essendi—how does Aristotle’s energeia become actualitas? > Romans understood ergon, energeia, on basis of AGERE, “to make,” in an ontic sense, so Summum ens becomes CREATOR, ENS CREATUM (INCREATUM) > ontic determination of actualitas together w/ Aquinas’ Summum Ens w/ Ipsum esse, ontology suppresses possibility for question of Being > to restore (weider einsetzen) philosophy to its own essence: purge (entlasten) it of its Christian element

HDG.FS.content: reach speculative when predicate of sentence (being) is made into subject: God is being itself becomes being is God: the meaning of “is” has changed: not a mere reversal, a counter-blow (Gegenstoss) [spirit of revenge in dialectic?], counter-movement (Gegenbewegung) of 2nd “is” upon 1st “is”: Eckhart said Istic-heit, Being is God understood speculatively: Being lets God be God, “is” speaks in transitive/active

motif.name: GOD in DES TOURS DES BABEL
motif.title: GOD in DES TOURS DES BABEL

HDG.FS.linkedContent: reach speculative when predicate of sentence (being) is made into subject: God is being itself becomes being is God: the meaning of “is” has changed: not a mere reversal, a counter-blow (Gegenstoss) [spirit of revenge in dialectic?], counter-movement (Gegenbewegung) of 2nd “is” upon 1st “is”: Eckhart said Istic-heit, Being is God understood speculatively: Being lets God be God, “is” speaks in transitive/active

HDG.FS.content: Hegel’s Logic presents God’s thought before creation [?] > “creation” as production (Herstellung) of world > via Aristotle, before creation, God thinks eidos of world, totality of categories: Hegel’s ontology presents ontology from which God takes measure of his creation (Kant’s intuitus originarius)

motif.name: GOD in DES TOURS DES BABEL
motif.title: GOD in DES TOURS DES BABEL

HDG.FS.linkedContent: Hegel’s Logic presents God’s thought before creation [?] > “creation” as production (Herstellung) of world > via Aristotle, before creation, God thinks eidos of world, totality of categories: Hegel’s ontology presents ontology from which God takes measure of his creation (Kant’s intuitus originarius)

HDG.DL.content: explanation (Erläuterung) of hermeneutics may issue (versteht) in a discussion (Erörterung) [Trakl essay] > hermenuein to hermeneus to Hermes (playful thought more compelling than rigor of sense): divine messenger, brings message of destiny (Botschaft des Geschickes) > hermeneuein: explanation that brings tidings (Kunde), can listen to a message > Plato’s Ion: poets “are interpreters (hermenes) of gods” > hermeneutics not just interpretation but the bearing (das Bringen) of message/tidings

motif.name: GOD in DES TOURS DES BABEL
motif.title: GOD in DES TOURS DES BABEL

HDG.DL.linkedContent: explanation (Erläuterung) of hermeneutics may issue (versteht) in a discussion (Erörterung) [Trakl essay] > hermenuein to hermeneus to Hermes (playful thought more compelling than rigor of sense): divine messenger, brings message of destiny (Botschaft des Geschickes) > hermeneuein: explanation that brings tidings (Kunde), can listen to a message > Plato’s Ion: poets “are interpreters (hermenes) of gods” > hermeneutics not just interpretation but the bearing (das Bringen) of message/tidings

HDG.OHF.content: hermeneutics from ermēneuein (interpreting), related to god Hermes

motif.name: GOD in DES TOURS DES BABEL
motif.title: GOD in DES TOURS DES BABEL

HDG.OHF.content: [series of historical quotes on (Christian) concept of “Man” (Paul, Tatian, Augustine, Aquinas, Zwingli, Calvin, Scheler)] Scheler: man is intention/gesture of transcendence itself, gateway for grace, theo-morphism, an X which is finite/living image of God [Heidegger proclaims: “clear enough: a panorama! a picture, a story (Roman)!”] > Scheler ruins both theology/philosophy: a method of looking away (Hinwegsehens) from facticity

motif.name: GOD in DES TOURS DES BABEL
motif.title: GOD in DES TOURS DES BABEL

HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [series of historical quotes on (Christian) concept of “Man” (Paul, Tatian, Augustine, Aquinas, Zwingli, Calvin, Scheler)] Scheler: man is intention/gesture of transcendence itself, gateway for grace, theo-morphism, an X which is finite/living image of God [Heidegger proclaims: “clear enough: a panorama! a picture, a story (Roman)!”] > Scheler ruins both theology/philosophy: a method of looking away (Hinwegsehens) from facticity

HDG.OHF.content: acc. Scheler, Luther first to describe man as flesh (caro) [confusing Luther w/ prophet Isaiah (40:6)], flesh as corruption, definitively negative relation to God (man stands against God)—this is constitutive! [Christianity]

motif.name: GOD in DES TOURS DES BABEL
motif.title: GOD in DES TOURS DES BABEL

HDG.OHF.linkedContent: acc. Scheler, Luther first to describe man as flesh (caro) [confusing Luther w/ prophet Isaiah (40:6)], flesh as corruption, definitively negative relation to God (man stands against God)—this is constitutive! [Christianity]

HDG.OHF.content: covering up of soil from which which definition of human arose: logon exon, animal rationale [rational becomes the logical], Christian Dasein as person capable of knowing, human cut to the measure of faith (glaubensmässig vorbestimmt) as being-created (Geschaffensein) in image of God

motif.name: GOD in DES TOURS DES BABEL
motif.title: GOD in DES TOURS DES BABEL

HDG.OHF.linkedContent: covering up of soil from which which definition of human arose: logon exon, animal rationale [rational becomes the logical], Christian Dasein as person capable of knowing, human cut to the measure of faith (glaubensmässig vorbestimmt) as being-created (Geschaffensein) in image of God

HDG.OHF.content: for faith, man is “fallen,” his being-fallen not derived from God, but state into which man brought himself [explanation of Kant-like co-givenness of man’s goodness & his possibility of falling] > primordial experience of being-sinful (Sündigseins) at particular time: closed context of experience, basis of anthropology of Christian theology > [Nietzsche-like] God-relation (as constitutive) neutralized into consciousness of norms/values, center of acts (archē), “Ego-pole”
